page.title: 08THE WATERWORKS AND RESERVOIR
page.content: The Waterworks and reservoir are situated at the east end of the village of Castle Carrock. The project was started in 1905, completed in 1908 and in use ever since. The reservoir holds approx. 180 million gallons of water. The source of the water is at Geltsdale on the fells 3 miles east of the Works. The water comes from springs in the catchment area and is piped directly into the reservoir from where it is filtered, tested, and then piped for use to Carlisle and district: 3 million gallons each day being consumed. Two employees, the foreman and filter attendant, live on the Works and two more travel in each day. Additional labour is brought in when needed.
